009
010package imagingbook.common.geometry.fd;
011
012import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
014
015/**
016 * <p>
017 * This class is used to re-sample 2D polygons by interpolation. See Sec. 2.1.1
018 * (Alg. 26.1) if [1] for details. Note that this class has no public
019 * constructor, use {@link #getInstance()} instead.
020 * </p>
021 * <p>
022 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing &ndash; An
023 * Algorithmic Introduction Using Java</em>, 2rd ed, Springer (2016).
024 * </p>
025 * 
026 * @author WB
027 * @version 2022/10/26
028 */
029public class PolygonSampler {   // TODO: add unit tests
030        
031        private static final PolygonSampler instance = new PolygonSampler();
032        
033        private PolygonSampler() {}
034        
035        public static PolygonSampler getInstance() {
036                return instance;
037        }
038        
039        /**
040         * Samples the closed polygon path specified by V at M equidistant positions.
041         * 
042         * @param V the vertices of the (closed) polygon.
043         * @param M the number of sample points.
044         * @return the sample points as an array of Point objects.
045         */
046        public Pnt2d[] samplePolygon(Pnt2d[] V, int M) {
047                int N = V.length;
048                double Delta = pathLength(V) / M;       // constant segment length in Q
049                // distribute N points along polygon path P
050                Pnt2d[] S = new Pnt2d[M];
051//              S[0] = (Point) V[0].clone();            // q_0 = p_0 (duplicate p_0)
052                S[0] = PntDouble.from(V[0]);            // q_0 = p_0 (duplicate p_0)
053                int i = 0;                      // lower index of segment (i,i+1) in P
054                int j = 1;                      // index of next point to be added to Q
055                double alpha = 0;       // lower boundary of current path segment in P
056                double beta = Delta;    // path position of next point to be added to Q
057                // for all M segments in P do:
058                while (i < N && j < M) {
059                        Pnt2d vA = V[i];
060                        Pnt2d vB = V[(i + 1) % N];
061                        double delta = vA.distance(vB);
062                        // handle segment (i,i+1) with path boundaries (a,a+d), knowing a < b
063                        while (beta <= alpha + delta && j < M) {
064                                // a < b <= a+d
065                                S[j] = interpolate(vA, vB, (beta - alpha) / delta);
066                                j = j + 1;
067                                beta = beta + Delta;
068                        }
069                        alpha = alpha + delta;
070                        i = i + 1;
071                }       
072                return S;
073        }
074        
075        /**
076         * For testing only: allows to choose an arbitrary start point by setting
077         * 'startFrac' in [0,1].
078         * 
079         * @param V         the vertices of the (closed) polygon.
080         * @param M         the number of sample points.
081         * @param startFrac the position of the first sample as a fraction of the
082         *                  polggon's circumference in [0,1].
083         * @return the sample points as an array of Point objects.
084         */
085        public Pnt2d[] samplePolygon(Pnt2d[] V, int M, double startFrac) {
086                int startPos = (int) Math.round(V.length * startFrac) % V.length;
087                return samplePolygon(shiftLeft(V, startPos), M);
088        }
089        
090        private Pnt2d[] shiftLeft(Pnt2d[] V, int startPos) {
091                int polyLen = V.length;
092                Pnt2d[] P2 = new Pnt2d[polyLen]; 
093                for (int i = 0; i < P2.length; i++) {
094//                      P2[i] = (Point) V[(i + startPos) % polyLen].clone();
095                        P2[i] = PntDouble.from(V[(i + startPos) % polyLen]);
096                }
097                return P2;
098        }
099        
100        
101        private double pathLength(Pnt2d[] V) {
102                double L = 0;
103                final int N = V.length;
104                for (int i = 0; i < N; i++) {
105                        Pnt2d p0 = V[i];
106                        Pnt2d p1 = V[(i + 1) % N];
107                        L = L + p0.distance(p1);
108                }
109                return L;
110        }
111        
112        private Pnt2d interpolate(Pnt2d p0, Pnt2d p1, double alpha) {
113                // alpha is in [0,1]
114                double x = p0.getX() + alpha * (p1.getX() - p0.getX());
115                double y = p0.getY() + alpha * (p1.getY() - p0.getY());
116                return Pnt2d.PntDouble.from(x, y);
117        }
118        
119}
